channel.description: Craft is a list of hand oriented craft and technology Do we really need all those power tools?

item.title: Kelly Mehler, 1947-2025
item.description: It is with grief that I report Kelly Mehler died early Sunday morning, Oct. 5, 2025. As you might know, he’d been fighting cancer for some time, but I heard from him recently when he told me he was feeling great and doing well, and working on a tool chest in his shop. So this...
item.source:markdown: It is with grief that I report Kelly Mehler died early Sunday morning, Oct. 5, 2025. As you might know, he’d been fighting cancer for some time, but I heard from him recently when he told me he was feeling great and doing well, and working on a tool chest in his shop. So this...

item.title: Mind the Gap
item.description: No matter how well you typically cut dovetails, sometimes the gods are simply not smiling upon you. I have days when I pick up my dovetail saw, make a few cuts and quickly realize that I should instead rough out lumber, clean out the offcut bin or do something else that doesn’t require precision. And...
item.source:markdown: No matter how well you typically cut dovetails, sometimes the gods are simply not smiling upon you. item.title: 106. StewMac's Brock Poling and Gene Imbody
item.description:
On Episode 106 of the Luthier on Luthier podcast, I’m joined by Brock Poling and Gene Imbody from Stewart-MacDonald—the original luthier supply company.
 
Brock and Gene take us behind the scenes to show how StewMac tools and products are developed, from the first idea all the way to delivery. We also talk about the company’s history and where they see it heading in the future.
 
Link:
https://www.stewmac.com/

Luthier on Luthier is hosted by Michael Bashkin of Bashkin Guitars and brought to you by the Fretboard Journal. This episode is sponsored by Dream Guitars and StewMac.

Want to support Luthier on Luthier? Join our Patreon to get access to exclusive photos and content from Michael and his builds.
item.source:markdown:
On Episode 106 of the Luthier on Luthier podcast, I’m joined by Brock Poling and Gene Imbody from Stewart-MacDonald—the original luthier supply company.
Brock and Gene take us behind the scenes to show how StewMac tools and products are developed, from the first idea all the way to delivery. We also talk about the company’s history and where they see it heading in the future.
Link:
[https://www.stewmac.com/](https://www.stewmac.com/)
Luthier on Luthier is hosted by Michael Bashkin of [Bashkin Guitars](https://www.bashkinguitars.com) and brought to you by the [Fretboard Journal](https://shop.fretboardjournal.com/products/fretboard-journal-annual-subscription). This episode is sponsored by [Dream Guitars](https://www.dreamguitars.com/) and [StewMac](https://www.stewmac.com/?irclickid=VA-TmuXZ%3AxyPUn0Ut-05ZTupUkHUPAzGE2bmy00&utm_source=3755630&utm_medium=Impact&utm_campaign=3755630&utm_content=Online%20Tracking%20Link_1303370&irgwc=1&partner=Fretboard%20Journal&mpid=3755630&group=).
Want to support Luthier on Luthier? [Join our Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/luthieronluthier) to get access to exclusive photos and content from Michael and his builds.

item.title: Sandpaper Saver
item.description:
Sanding between coats of polyurethane is tough on sandpaper. And I make it tougher, because I never wait the recommended 72 hours before recoating. But if the finish isn’t bone-dry, the paper is likely to gum up. When my sandpaper …

Source
item.source:markdown:

item.title: Festool ETSC 2 Sander Review
item.description:
Tool: ETSC 2 125 Random Orbit Sander Shop Now  Manufacturer: Festool MSRP: $598 (kit includes sander, 2x 4Ah batteries, charger, dust bag, edge guard, and Systainer) If you’ve been reading this magazine for a while, you might have noticed …

item.source:markdown:

item.title: An Interlude in Shanghai
item.description: The following is excerpted from “James Krenov: Leave Fingerprints,” by Brendan Bernhardt Gaffney.  After years of research and more than 150 interviews, Gaffney produced a definitive biography of Krenov, featuring historical documents, press clippings and hundreds of historical photographs. Gaffney traced Krenov’s life from his birth in a small village in far-flung Russia, to China,...

item.title: For Sale: Comb-back in Elm, Sycamore & Oak
item.description: This seven-stick comb-back is Katherine’s first apprenticeship chair, which we built together while teaching a class last week. It’s set up for lounging, with back sticks that rake 20° back and a seat tilt for lounging.   Like all stick chairs, this one bears imperfections that mark how it was made. The leg angles are not...
